title: US senators announce cross-party push to sanction Turkey over Syria offensive
text:
Leading Republican and Democrat senators have launched a joint push to impose hard-hitting sanctions on Turkey over its military offensive in Syria, despite Donald Trump’s limited condemnation.

Lindsey Graham, the Republican senator for South Carolina and one the US president’s most prominent allies, joined Democrat Chris Van Hollen in publishing a bill to punish Turkey for its actions.

The pair propose sanctioning all US assets of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan as well as those of his vice president and ministers in charge of defence, foreign affairs, finance, trade and energy.

They also want to ban US military assistance to the Turkish armed forces and sanction anyone who sells or supports the Turkish military, among other punishments.

Mr Trump’s initial willingness to let Turkey carry out their invasion has developed into a mild rebuking this week, with the president saying he does not back the move and thinks it is a “bad idea”.
